title: Space Force chief: Satellites are under threat, ‘we have to be ready’
summary: Threats to U.S. satellites are becoming more complex and unpredictable, which will require new ways of training and preparing for a possible conflict, Gen. B. Chance Saltzman, U.S. chief of space operations, said Jan. 31.

title: NASA Extends Goddard Logistics, Technical Services Contract
summary: NASA has awarded a modification to extend the period of performance of the Goddard Logistics and Technical Information II (GLTI II) Services Contract with TRAX International Corporation of Las Vegas.

title: Orbital Sidekick raises $10 million from customers and existing investors
summary: Hyperspectral imaging startup Orbital Sidekick raised $10 million in an investment round led by Energy Innovation Capital.

title: Capella Space establishes new subsidiary focused on U.S. defense market
summary: Capella Space announced Jan. 31 it is forming a new business unit, Capella Federal, that will offer “increased Earth observation access to select U.S. defense customers.”

title: NASA Spinoffs Bolster Climate Resilience, Improve Medical Care, More
summary: When it comes to NASA, most people look to the skies as rockets, rovers, and astronauts push the boundaries of space exploration. But the benefits of going above and beyond can be found here on Earth through products and services born from NASA innovation.
